{"tiddlers":{"$:/plugins/linonetwo/tag-tree-picker-macro/readme":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/tag-tree-picker-macro/readme","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"!! Macro usage This traditional tag list will show tags in a line: ```tw5 <$vars currentTiddler="$:/plugins/linonetwo/tw-calendar/settings/frequently-used-tags" tagField="text"> {{||$:/core/ui/EditTemplate/tags}} ``` But this plugin provides a `tag-tree-picker` macro to show tags in a tree: ```tw5 <$transclude $variable="tag-tree-picker" tags={{TiddlerWithListOfTags}} /> ``` `tags` parameter receive a list of tiddler name, if those tiddlers have tree relationship, show then as tree. To make click-on-it work, you need to define `tag-tree-button-action` macro in the context, this is work as a `onClick` callback action: ```tw5 \define tag-tree-button-action(tagName) <$action-navigate $to="$tagName$" /> \end \define tag-tree-button-action(tagName) <$action-listops $tags="[[$tagName$]]" $tiddler="""$(targetTiddler)$""" /> \end \define tag-tree-button-action(tagName) <$action-listops $tags="[[$tagName$]]" $tiddler="Index" /> \end ``` Note that tags in this tree are buttons, so action is not "add tag to currentTiddler" by default, you need to define the onClick action you want. !! Example A tag picker ```tw5 \define tag-tree-button-action(tagName) <$action-listops $tags="[[$tagName$]]" $tiddler="""$(targetTiddler)$""" /> \end \define empty-list-help-text()

You can goto Plugin Setting in control panel or plugin page, add frequently used tags here.

\end
